title: [FEATURE]
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I need to get the glyph path for a specific glyph id, not for a string.
The SkFont in skia has the getPath method.
SkiaSharp is missing the SKFont class and bindings though.
https://skia.org/user/api/SkFont_Reference#SkFont_getPath


**Describe the solution you'd like**
Please add a wrapper for SkFont.


**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I used the GetTextPath method from SKPaint. But when I shape with HarfBuzz, the codepoints differ for ligature texts (e.g. tt gets converted to one glyph for two characters).
I have no possibility to get the correct glyph path for this glyph id.
The glyp id I get from HarfBuzz.
Is there any way to use this glyph id elsewhere?


Thanks for all the work to the team! Great work!

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body:
GetTextPath should work with GlyphId just copy the glyph id's from the shaped result into a buffer and pass that buffer to GetTextPath. Make sure the text encoding is set to GlyphId.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/skiasharp.skpaint.gettextpath?view=skiasharp-1.68.0#SkiaSharp_SKPaint_GetTextPath_System_IntPtr_System_IntPtr_System_Single_System_Single_

GlyphId is represented by two bytes
